security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown files. No executable code present. Describes Chrome DevTools Protocol usage which is a standard debugging tool. No malicious patterns detected.

content.user_title: Debug web apps with Chrome DevTools
content.value_statement: Web applications can be difficult to debug when console errors and network issues occur. This skill provides access to Chrome DevTools Protocol for inspecting console output, monitoring network requests, and analyzing performance to quickly identify and resolve issues.
actual_capabilities: Inspect console errors, warnings, and log messages from the browser
Monitor and analyze network requests including headers and response bodies
Execute JavaScript code in browser context for debugging
Debug authenticated sessions by examining localStorage and cookies
Navigate pages and wait for content to load
limitations: Requires Chrome browser running with remote debugging enabled
Cannot take screenshots or automate form filling
Chrome must be started manually with debugging port

use_cases.title: Debug JavaScript errors
use_cases.description: Quickly identify and locate console errors in web applications during development

use_cases.title: Monitor API failures
use_cases.description: Track failed network requests and identify issues with backend integrations

use_cases.title: Analyze performance
use_cases.description: Record traces to find slow resources and optimize page load times

prompt_templates.title: Check console errors
prompt_templates.prompt: Check the console for errors on the current page using chrome-devtools-debugging. List any errors and their stack traces.

prompt_templates.title: Find slow requests
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze network requests using chrome-devtools-debugging. Identify any requests that took longer than 1 second.

prompt_templates.title: Debug auth state
prompt_templates.prompt: Debug the authenticated session using chrome-devtools-debugging. Check localStorage for auth tokens and list recent API requests.

prompt_templates.title: Full page analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a full debugging session using chrome-devtools-debugging: get console errors, list all API requests, check for failed requests, and evaluate JavaScript to get the page title and any application state.

output_examples.input: Check the console for errors and find any slow network requests
output: - Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'data' of undefined at app.js:45
- Failed to load resource: net::ERR_CONNECTION_REFUSED at dashboard:12

best_practices: Start Chrome with --remote-debugging-port=9222 before using this skill
Set the CHROME_DEVTOOLS_URL environment variable to your debugging endpoint
Use pagination when dealing with large console or network logs
Combine console and network analysis to correlate errors with failed requests
anti_patterns: Using this skill for screenshots or basic browser automation (use browser-discovery instead)
Not verifying the CHROME_DEVTOOLS_URL is pointing to your local browser
Attempting to debug without first checking that Chrome remote debugging is enabled
Running this skill against production browsers without understanding the security implications

faq.question: Does this work with Firefox or Safari?
faq.answer: No, this skill uses Chrome DevTools Protocol which is specific to Chromium-based browsers like Chrome and Edge.

faq.question: What is the maximum number of console messages?
faq.answer: The MCP server returns up to 100 messages per page with pagination support for large log sets.

faq.question: Can I use this with MCP servers like npx chrome-devtools-mcp?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill documents usage patterns for the chrome-devtools-mcp server which should be installed separately.

faq.question: Is my browsing data safe?
faq.answer: This skill accesses your local Chrome browser data. Only use with browsers you own or have permission to debug.

faq.question: Chrome is not connecting, what do I do?
faq.answer: Verify Chrome is running with --remote-debugging-port=9222 and the CHROME_DEVTOOLS_URL environment variable is set correctly.

faq.question: How is this different from browser automation skills?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on debugging and analysis. For screenshots, form filling, and basic navigation, use the browser-discovery skill instead.
